questionText: How do scientists decide which characteristics are most important when classifying animals?
Why do some animals that look alike belong to different taxonomic groups?
What role does DNA play in classifying and understanding animal relationships?
How does taxonomy help us understand the history and evolution of life on Earth?
How does taxonomy help scientists understand our world? How can we use taxonomy to better understand animals?
What do you think would happen if scientists stopped using taxonomy? How would it affect our understanding of animals?
How does Darwin’s theory explain why some species survive while others go extinct?
What role does natural selection play in shaping the traits of animals over time?
The more species diversifies, the less likely it is to go extinct. Why is that?
What concept did this game demonstrate?
How do mutations contribute to evolution, and are all mutations helpful?
How do humans impact biodiversity, and what can we do to protect it?
How do biotic (living) and abiotic (non-living) factors influence where animals are found?
What role does population density play in an ecosystem’s health and stability?
How do human activities like deforestation, pollution, and climate change impact species distribution?
Why are biodiversity and conservation important? Why do distribution patterns vary per region?
Which is which?
Why do some species thrive in urban environments while others struggle to survive?
If you were designing a wildlife conservation plan, what steps would you take to protect species and their habitats?
How does studying animal behavior help us learn about human behavior?
What role does communication play in animal survival and reproduction?
How do predator and prey behaviors evolve to help each survive?
Why do some animals develop complex social structures while others remain solitary?
How do animals use intelligence and problem-solving to find food or avoid danger?
How do behaviors of an animal link to its ability to survive? How does this affect other animals?
How does understanding animal anatomy help scientists learn about evolution and adaptation?
How do an animal’s internal organs, like the heart and lungs, work together to keep it alive?
Why do different species have such different life cycles, and how does metamorphosis benefit some animals?
Why do some animals have unique abilities, like echolocation or venom, and how do these functions help them?
What is the purpose of studying anatomy and the bodily functions of animals?
If you could design an animal with the most powerful body features from different species, what would it look like and why?
